snippet.title: Top two deliver telling blows
snippet.content:
Top-two teams Gosford and Norths landed telling blows against fellow premiership contenders in round 18 of the Hunter Coast Premier Hockey League on Sunday. Front-runners Gosford maintained their unbeaten run with a 3-2 victory over third-placed Souths at Newcastle International Hockey Centre while Norths all-but cemented second spot after rallying late with back-to-back goals in quick succession to run down the Rams 2-1 at Maitland. The same four sides will go head-to-head in next month's semi-final series.
HIGH: Five goals for Rob Owen of The Entrance. Picture: Natalie Grono At the other end of the competition ladder The Entrance's Rob Owen scored five in a 6-4 triumph against last-placed University in a battle for the wooden spoon.
Wests had the bye. LADDER: Gosford 29, Norths 25, Souths 21, Maitland 16, Wests 9, The Entrance 5, University 3.
